actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Crime and Federal Government Surveillance

official_title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to prohibit certain conduct relating to the use of horses for human consumption.
short_title: Prevention of Equine Cruelty Act of 2009
subjects: Crimes against animals and natural resources

summary.text: Prevention of Equine Cruelty Act of 2009 - Amends the federal criminal code to impose a fine and/or prison term of up to three years for possessing, shipping, transporting, purchasing, selling, delivering, or receiving any horse, horse flesh, or carcass with the intent that it be used for human consumption. Reduces the prison term to one year if the offense involves less than five horses or less than 2,000 pounds of horse flesh or carcass and the offender has no prior conviction for this offense.

titles.title: Prevention of Equine Cruelty Act of 2009
Prevention of Equine Cruelty Act of 2009
To amend title 18, United States Code, to prohibit certain conduct relating to the use of horses for human consumption.
